intro: Euploca haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian euploca, is a flowering plant native to Haiti. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in the mountainous regions of the island. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue or purple flowers. Euploca haitiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its native habitat.
